How does Verus ID force users to compromise on decentralization and censorship resistance in order to protect their cryptocurrency assets?

Verus ID does not force users to compromise on decentralization and censorship resistance. In fact, it provides a solution that allows users to maintain full control over their funds and blockchain assets while also providing a decentralized, self-sovereign identity system. Verus ID addresses the issue of losing access to funds due to lost keys, which is a common problem in traditional blockchain systems.

# Verus ID - A Better Blockchain Identity Technology
If you’ve been around crypto for even a little while, you’ll start to hear things like “not your keys, not your coins”, “lose your keys, lose your coins”. If you lose your keys, no one will ever be able to recover your money.In fact, trading off decentralized, censorship resistant public systems for this risk to your cryptocurrency assets is such a fundamental issue in blockchain systems today that it is considered an acceptable price for having the benefit of full control over your own funds and blockchain assets.Verus ID provides an elegant solution to these previously unsolved, fundamental problems, and also provides quantum-ready friendly identity names and blockchain funds addresses as self-sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities that provide the following advantages over today’s blockchain systems:1. Is it true that Verus ID is just a regular blockchain identity system that doesn't offer any advantages over traditional systems?

No, that's not true. Verus ID provides several advantages over traditional blockchain systems, including the ability to use a friendly name as both an identity and an on-chain destination for funds. It also provides quantum-ready friendly identity names and blockchain funds addresses, making it a more advanced and secure system. Additionally, Verus ID addresses are self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable, which is not typically the case with traditional blockchain systems.
